attributes.action: Make PSA tests mandatory for all men over 50
attributes.background:
Join Male Cancer charity Balls to Cancer's campaign to get mandatory PSA tests for all men over 50. 
Prostate cancer is the biggest cancer killer for men over 50 in the UK killing 40,000 men annually.
Help us make government make this as important as breast & smear testing
attributes.additional_details: If every man over 50 has a PSA test more cases of prostate cancer could be found and treated early saving many lives.

attributes.action: Get the transport secretary to review the C2C rail contract.
attributes.background: Since Trentalia took over the C2C contract the service has become so bad it is directly affecting customers lives. Frequent train malfunctions, delays and staff on the social media channels lying to the customers about being able to claim delay repay are rendering the service unusable.
attributes.additional_details:
Some of the things C2C customers have suffered from of late include:

- Being ejected at stations like Barking or Upminster with no explanation.
- Being lied to that delay repay covers your total journey when the online system ONLY takes into account train time.
- Broken trains on a regular basis.
- Cancelled trains on a regular basis.
- Shortened trains every day since last summer.
- Delays on a weekly basis that do not 'qualify' for a refund.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for domesticated cats and dogs to be spayed/neutered.
attributes.background: Not spaying/neutering pets has caused shelters to be full to capacity.,therefore there are many strays and feral animals on the streets, struggling  to survive with little help.

attributes.action: Abolish changes to free school meals
attributes.background: Recent government changes to the free school meal system will mean millions of vulnerable and less well off children will loose out on their only hot meal of the day

attributes.action: Ask UN to take Jerusalem under its protection.
attributes.background: US recognition of Jerusalem as Israel's capital has emboldened Israel to carry on denying that East Jerusalem is occupied. The only fair solution is to return to the 1947 Partition Plan and make Jerusalem a corpus separatum.

attributes.action: Establish a special unit to tackle the misconduct of public officials.
attributes.background:
Abuse of the public's trust has become normalised: it is simply accepted as the way things are and not treated as the criminal offence that it is.
The police cannot get involved in political decisions and for this reason have proven too cautious over this offence, hence the need for a special unit.
attributes.additional_details:
Taking the nation to war on a lie or rending the nation asunder with a promise that there is no intention of keeping are serious abuses of the public's trust, or at least they appear so to me. 

https://www.cps.gov.uk/legal-guidance/misconduct-public-office

Too often we hear tales of public officers abusing their powers to line their pockets or conceal their wrongdoings, yet we almost never hear of these things being investigated. This need to stop.

attributes.action: Introduce a health and safety law on the maximum temperature in a workplace
attributes.background: With the current heatwave in the UK employees all over the country are suffering and struggling to continue working. Many institutions lack working air conditioning systems and without a law on the maximum temperatures within workplaces, employers are doing very little to aid the welfare of staff.
attributes.additional_details: In some fast food restaurants, kitchens are reaching highs of 36 degrees Celsius. Staff working in kitchens of all kinds are surrounded by grills, oil fryers, and heated surfaces, and cannot drink within their station for fear of cross contamination. All of these factors combine to make workplaces unbearable, and especially those working around food who sweat profusely in these conditions, it is not just them but the consumers at risk.

attributes.action: Enact a Gaelic Languages Act; equal status for Irish, Scottish Gaelic & Welsh
attributes.background: The Welsh Language Act 1993 recognises that language on a UK-wide basis and status not enjoyed by Irish or Scottish Gaelic. The UK Government agreed to an Irish Act as part of the St Andrew's Agreement 2006. A UK 'Gaelic Languages Act' would be non-sectarian and give Gaelic the same status as Welsh.
attributes.additional_details:
In the UK you can establish a company, pay your taxes and renew your MOT in Welsh. The same should be true of Gaelic.


Welsh Language Act 1993:

https://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/1993/38/contents

St Andrew's Agreement 2006:

https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/136651/st_andrews_agreement-2.pdf

Background in English: https://goo.gl/WpYhuW

Faisnéis chúlra i nGaeilge: https://goo.gl/MvU4YP

Cùl-fhiosrachadh ann an Gàidhlig: https://goo.gl/TSkBfd

attributes.action: Make it a fineable offence to cross tidal roads outside of safe crossing times.
attributes.background: Every year dozens of people ignore the safe crossing times at the Holy Island causeway and are rescued by the RNLI. This not only risks lives and uses a service that could be required elsewhere, but also costs the taxpayer tens of thousands of pounds each year which could be avoided.
attributes.additional_details:
Figures from the Ministry of Defence in 2017 show a sea rescue costs approximately £1,900, while an air rescue by the RAF costs more than £4,000.

This petition relates to all tidal roads and causeways in the UK.

We, the undersigned, would like to see drivers who ignore safe crossing times on tidal roads/causeways and require rescue be fined for their actions, and for this money to be invested in the RNLI.

attributes.action: Support the curry industry by reviewing immigration policy
attributes.background: The British curry industry is suffering since the government's cap on skilled workers was introduced over 10 years ago. We urge the government to review and reverse this policy as this cap is creating a vacuum in the area of skilled chefs, damaging growth and sustainability of the industry.
attributes.additional_details:
Previous attempts by this and former governments to train chefs within specialized Training Centres of Excellence in the UK have consistently failed to produce the skilled chefs required to address the shortage. Closures of restaurants around the country are at an alarming rate of 3-4 per week. Heavy handed raids by UKBA and heavily imposed penalties add to the burden levied upon the restaurateurs eager to maintain and survive the current economic climate.
For further info visit www.bca1960.com”
attributes.creator_name: Mohammed Mustafa Kamal Yakub, on behalf of the Bangladesh Caterers Association

attributes.action: Supervise people's mental health issues when they are prescribed dangerous drugs
attributes.background: My mother, who suffered from mental health issues, was given a weekly prescription of Amitriptyline without any supervision. My mother was saving them up over some time and committed suicide with these pills. Yes, they may be good for specific conditions, but not for vulnerable people.
attributes.additional_details: Vulnerable people suffering from mental health issues should be supervised when prescribed pills like Amitriptyline in a controlled environment with a healthcare professional. Sometimes people who are suffering from mental health problems don't think rationally like other people. They are vulnerable and need protection from harm. So why would you put them in harm’s way with lethal drugs? We lost my mother the worst way possible and it could have been prevented.

attributes.action: Financial support &employment support/protection for women with endometriosis
attributes.background: 1 in 10 women suffer with endometriosis in the UK. Women are losing their jobs, having financial difficulties, being treated unfairly by employers and are not protected even though this is a long term chronic illness with no cure. We need protection and help please. Repeat surgeries and treatments.
attributes.additional_details:
Endometriosis falls under the NHS most 20 painful conditions https://www.nhs.uk/Livewell/Pain/Pages/20-painful-conditions.aspx 
 
This illness is serious, we are having surgeries every year some of us and more than once a year. However, we've no protection in work and it is not recognised by all employers as serious and we are not fully protected by the disability act or any act. 

Some women have been fired, we have no benefits available to us either if we are no longer able to work.

attributes.action: Ban the use and production of micro-plastic glitter!
attributes.background:
Micro-plastic glitters are used in everyday items; posing an ecological hazard to our oceans and aquatic life.
There is a ban on micro-beads and we call for this ban to be extended to micro-plastic glitter.
attributes.additional_details:
Micro-plastic glitter passes through waterways into the ocean, marine life and birds mistake it for food; glitters are produced with toxic additives; which is then consumed by us. It has been reported that plastic was found in a third of UK-caught fish. With approx. 51 million fragments in the ocean.

These micro-plastic glitter can break down to release chemicals that disrupt hormones in the bodies of both animals and humans
We hold a responsibility to future generations to stop this pollution.

attributes.action: The UK must NOT adopt any new EU legislation during the "transition period".
attributes.background: On June 23rd 2016 the UK voted to Leave the European Union. We voted to take back control of our laws. If we are to have a "transition period" it would be completely unacceptable for the UK to accept any new EU rules and regulations during this transition period.
attributes.additional_details: Brexit means taking back control of our money, our borders, our trade deals and our laws. We voted for significant change and we expect to see change.

attributes.action: Amend the law so Chartered Legal Executives can certify Powers of Attorney
attributes.background: At present we cannot certify General or Lasting Powers of Attorney under existing legislation despite the fact that we can apply to run our own legal practices or be a Judge. It causes confusion for clients and we are having to rely on the goodwill of Solicitor colleagues to assist certifying copies

attributes.action: Set up a public inquiry into Greater Manchester Police.
attributes.background: GMP has been the subject of negative media reports. Complaints have been to the Independent Office for Police Conduct & the Mayor, but there are still problems.
attributes.additional_details: Police forces shouldn’t be able to investigate themselves as GMP has done. That is a failing in the police complaints system, resulting in a lack of accountability for senior police officers. GMP also has primacy over the North-West Counter Terrorism Unit. Any problems in GMP could risk being transferred to the NWCTU, which could potentially have a national impact. We need a public inquiry now.

attributes.action: Stop Network Rail's programme to fell millions of trees
attributes.background: Network Rail recently began cutting down trees on a massive scale. We call on the government to halt this tree felling programme until a comprehensive public consultation has been conducted, to include relevant wildlife and environmental bodies such as The Wildlife Trust, RSPB, The Tree Council, etc
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/business/2018/apr/29/millions-of-trees-at-risk-in-secretive-network-rail-felling-programme

attributes.action: Create a change to the law on home invasions, to further protect residents.
attributes.background: Currently the law only allows for ‘reasonable force’ in protecting ones home from an armed invader. This is too vague. With legitimate fear of injury or death, householders must be protected from prosecution or arrest if such a threat gives rise to an altercation in which a home invader dies.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2012 the Justice Secretary proposed amending the law in England and Wales on self-defence to protect householders who over-react when confronted by a burglar or intruder. 

We want the law to be shifted in favour of the householder to give them certainty that they will not be prosecuted, if a home invader dies during the course of an invasion, when armed with a weapon that can cause servere injury or death. 

We propose a ‘Castle Law’ that will protect victims from prosecution.

attributes.action: Start the Gender Reform Act reformation process
attributes.background: The Government announced a consultation in 2016 to reform the Gender Recognition Act. This has been delayed for no explained reason, which has resulted in confusion, fear and misinformation, it’s delayed equality measures for our Trans and non-binary residents.
attributes.additional_details:
The Gender Recognition Act is in urgent need of reform if Her Majesty’s Government is to bring about full legal dignity for its trans and non-binary citizens. When the Women and Equalities Committee set out its recommendations for trans equality in 2016, it called to "update the GRA in line with principles of gender self-declaration [through statutory declaration] that have been developed in other jurisdictions", in turn removing the
medicalised, quasi-judicial process for gender recognition.

attributes.action: make it a criminal offence for a parent to deny contact after a court order
attributes.background: Currently there is nothing preventing a parent from not abiding to a court access order, meaning the non resident parent will have to repeatedly return to court to have it enforced. This has a negative emotional impact on both the parent and children. It's also time consuming and very costly.
attributes.additional_details: The police agree this happens too often, but they cant help because it is not a criminal offence, and can only advise returning to court, but unfortunately this can become a never ending cycle . Some parents even go as far as trying to cut the other parent out Completely, which is known as parental alienation. Research is being done on the negative emotional impact losing time with a loving parent has on children, and the law needs to be updated to reflect this and protect children and families.

attributes.action: change the law for people who commit animal cruelty to be sentenced  up to 5yrs
attributes.background: Social media is rife everyday with animal abuse stories, videos or photos. The sentences are not tough enough and do not act as any deterrent.  Also there is nothing in place to make sure offenders do not re-offend.  I want the gov to change the law to a max of 5 yrs by the end of this year.
attributes.additional_details: My prev petition was not clear enough.  The government has announced plans to increase the max sentence to 5 years but i would like to see this happening by the end of this year at the latest.

attributes.action: Change the law on smashing a car window to release a dog from a hot car.
attributes.background: At present, members of the public risk being prosecuted for criminal damage if they act on instinct and smash the window of a vehicle to release a distressed dog which is trapped inside the vehicle in hot weather. The burden of proof is upon them to show that smashing the window was necessary.
attributes.additional_details: Please change the law to allow for concerned members of the public to release animals (dogs) trapped inside vehicles by smashing a window in circumstances where it would be deemed reasonable to assume that the animal (dog) is suffering from heat stroke or is at imminent risk of suffering heatstroke. Place the burden of proof on the owner to demonstrate that the animal (dog) was not at risk.

attributes.action: Fund the dualling of the A120 from Hare Green to Harwich
attributes.background: There is an agreement in place for the stretch of the A120 to be dualled with funding from Hutchison Ports as part of planning permission for a container port at Bathside Bay, Harwich. But this has been delayed for years and the town cannot wait any longer - the road needs to be dualled now.
attributes.additional_details: With an ever increasing population and more lorries using Harwich International Port the road is under strain. It is also in need of complete relaying as the concrete slabs it was laid on are at the end of their lifespan. The road should be dualled now rather than relaying it as a single carriageway. Better road access is hoped to bring economic growth to Tendring, which has some of the most deprived wards in the country. It is also home to a major UK port - a gateway to Europe.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to ride a bike without a helmet.
attributes.background: In a majority of bicyclist deaths, the most serious injuries are to the head, highlighting the importance of wearing a bicycle helmet. 1 Helmet use has been estimated to reduce the odds of head injury by 50 percent, and the odds of head, face, or neck injury by 33 percent
attributes.additional_details:
What kids think on the subject. 
“Yes, it should be made the law because the only reason people don't wear helmets is because they would be made fun of. So if everyone wore one then no-one would be made fun of."

attributes.action: Introduce state registry system for medical cannabis cards in the UK
attributes.background: A system already stablished in several countries that allows the possession of cannabis by people suffering from a chronic or debilitating disease or condition which has been diagnosed by a licensed physician who believes the use of cannabis will benefit the patient's condition and well-being.
attributes.additional_details:
Amend current legislation and introduce a system similar to the one existing in Colorado (USA), where registered patients can obtain a valid ID which allows them to possess no more than two Oz of a usable form of the plant and to grow for personal use no more than 6 plants (maximum of 3 being mature plants) at a time.

A new report about the effects of cannabis is needed reflecting all the new evidence supporting its beneficial effects as well as solutions to the so called "harmful effects".

attributes.action: Ban low letterboxes in UK on new build
attributes.background: I would like to see the UK Government amend building regulations & ban low letterboxes as has been the case in Ireland Since January 1st 2001
attributes.additional_details:
Letter  boxes should be postman friendly..Low boxes can cause serious injury when you have quite a few in a row or on a round whilst carrying a sack of mail.
 Even just one low letterbox is one too many.. You wouldn't put the keyhole down there so why put the letterbox down there.

attributes.action: Remove the requirement to pay VAT by churches, specifically on building works.
attributes.background: 20% VAT is payable on extensions and refurbishments by churches (and other bodies) which are being undertaken for local communities, many in deprived areas and the amount taken from any funds raised by the churches makes it, in a lot if instances, difficult to carry out all the work required.
attributes.additional_details: Our church in Denton undertook a refurbishment in 2005 which brought many people & groups into the church & its premises, at a time when councils were closing facilities. Churches help by housing groups that otherwise would have to close, or at least restrict the work that they do. This type of includes working with various health groups, places for the young and old to meet, and much more. We are looking at a £1,000,000 project which incurs £200k in tax, this mean much of it will not be done.

attributes.action: Ban the shooting of Pheasants, Partridges and Grouse for sport.
attributes.background: 35 Million "game birds" are placed into the countryside annually for shooting, disrupting the environmental balance.  Native wildlife is killed to increase the number of game birds available for shooting. Damage to the environment and suffering to native species and to the game birds is unacceptable
attributes.additional_details: The the introduction of a tens millions of non-native birds upsets the environmental balance of our countryside increasing competition, especially for food amongst native birds. Wildlife such as foxes, crows, magpies, badgers and weasels are directly or indirectly affected by shooting, snaring, trapping and illegal poisoning carried out by gamekeepers. Additionally, the loss of predator species does in itself further disrupt the local wildlife balance as species such as rodents can then thrive.

attributes.action: Call for James Brokenshire to revoke planning permission to mine in Pont Valley
attributes.background: The opencast site covers 71ha of wildlife habitats, including nesting curlews and crested newts. There is no protection from the dust for the local residents and school. The Banks group have repeatedly violated the terms of their planning permission, beginning work without completing an access road.
attributes.additional_details: Britain's dependency on coal has plummeted to under 7% in 2017 compared to over 40% in 2012. The amount of coal to be taken from this site is insignificant in this context and not worth the extent of the environmental degradation and damage to health it will cause. Sajid Javid recognised that Britain is moving beyond this outdated way of thinking; James Brokenshire needs to step up and stop Durham County Council from allowing this. Coal is part of County Durham's heritage but not it's future.

attributes.action: Increase funding for the Royal Army Chaplains' Department.
attributes.background: For centuries the Royal Army Chaplains’ Department has ministered to soldiers and their families in times of war and peace. They provide spiritual support, pastoral care, and moral guidance to all.
attributes.additional_details: The planned closure of bases will lead to fewer Garrison Churches. I believe that they provide spiritual support, moral guidance and pastoral care that is invaluable for our Royal Army and that cannot be learned in a classroom.

attributes.action: Appoint a select committee to examine the cost of medication supplied to the NHS
attributes.background: A recent report in the UK press alleged that some suppliers were overcharging the NHS for medication.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament should form a select committee to examine this allegation and suggest practical ways the government can prevent the NHS from being abused in this way.

attributes.action: Reduce the school days to just four days a week.
attributes.background: It is good for students to take a break, so they have a positive attitude to learning because they would not be overworked. Students would really appreciate this as they could spend more time with their family and friends.

attributes.action: Allow Bashir Ahmadzai to stay in the UK indefinitely.
attributes.background: Bashir Ahmadzai came to the UK 6 years ago to escape the Taliban. He is profoundly deaf & court documents say he has “complex speech, language & communication difficulties”.  He is an extremely vulnerable young person who is under threat of deportation. We ask that he is allowed to remain in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: For more information please read this comprehensive piece about Bashir's case by Aditya Chakrabortty which appeared in the Guardian on 26 June: https://amp.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/jun/26/trump-british-brutality-us-mexico-border

attributes.action: GPs & other professionals to be given  training on pulmonary fibrosis
attributes.background: My wife has just been diagnosed with this horrible illness. Going online, I found that a lot of people suffering are begging for help, saying that their GPs cannot help them and relying on people with this illness for help on reading most of their problems.
attributes.additional_details: Even some comforting advice would go a long way from them struggling for it. As a group on facebook they are trying to console and help each other. But it's expert advice they are begging for but are being fobbed off by most of their GPs. This is very important as my wife until Christmas was my carer but now we are both relying on our two daughters having to work part time for us. My wife was a council carer working till she retired so she has had no proper retirement, both of us are 72 this year.

attributes.action: Make Alcoholic Drinks Carry A Health Warning.
attributes.background: I believe that Alcoholic Drinks should carry a Health Warning on the label, as Cigarettes do. These Health Warnings should include things such as: the possibility liver failure and other health issues that Alcohol consumption can cause, as well as carry a general warning to Not Drink and Drive.

attributes.action: Bring Oliver Robbins before the European Scrutiny Committee.
attributes.background: Mr Robbins has a key role in the negotiations for exiting the EU. He is a public servant and as such is answerable for actions that he has taken.
attributes.additional_details: In PMQs on 2nd May 2018, the Chair of the ESC asked the Prime Minister to request the presence of Ollie Robbins to answer questions for the Committee. He commented that Mr Robbins has been asked at least 3 times. It is unacceptable, when he is so involved in the negotiations, that he has shown such disregard to the Committee and the electorate.

attributes.action: Formally request the EU allow UK citizens to request EU citizenship after Brexit
attributes.background:
It is clear that only 36% of the UK population voted for Brexit despite the more publicised voter turnout of 51.89% leave voters

The EU would agree that 64% of UK citizens (quite possibly more now) would like to remain or at the least retain EU citizenship as they oppose solo UK citizenship

attributes.action: Introduce Emergency Visitor Visa for families of citizens with critical illness
attributes.background: My friend was diagnosed with cancer recently. Chemo makes her so sick that she struggles to take care of her 2 year daughter. Her mother applied for UK visitor visa to come and look after her and her family. However it was rejected saying she is not a genuine visitor and will not go back to Iran.
attributes.additional_details: A new visitor visa category should be introduced  for non-British immediate family members of British citizens with life threatening illnesses such as cancer or conditions requiring full-time care. This is to assist British citizens with family living outside of the UK in receiving the mental and physical support of their families, paramount to coping with their health issues and difficulties arising from their condition.

attributes.action: Create Constituents' Charter & Independent Ombudsman re: Complaints About MPs
attributes.background: At the moment, there is no definition of an MP's legal duties and obligations to their constituents. Of course, most do their jobs very well, but some do not. And at the moment, there is virtually nothing anyone can do about such 'rogue' MP's. That is why we want Parliament to:
attributes.additional_details:
1. Create a Constituents' Charter which will;
2. Define the legal obligations an MP has toward their constituents
3. Provide a clear legal definition of a 'legitimate' query
4. Require MPs to answer all 'legitimate' constituent queries
5. Define strict time limits for MP replies
6. Include an Independent Ombudsman for Complaints Against MPs

attributes.action: Vehicle theory test to include section on motorcycle awareness on the road
attributes.background: Please help change our vehical theory test in scotland! To include a mandatory section on how drivers and motorcycle riders can look out for each other on the road. So we can prevent a very high amount of Accidents regarding road users.
attributes.additional_details: 20% of all accidents on Scotland's non-build up roads involve motorbikes. Approximately 60% of all motorcycle fatlities in scotland occur on these carriageways. In 2017 their were 827 motorcycle accidents 34 were fatal. Not a single cause of motorbike accidents in 2017 were caused by flooded/icy road coditions. 50% of motorbike accidents in Scotland were 30mph or less! Riders are 40 times more likely to be KILLED than any other road user. We can change this! Please sign this petition.

attributes.action: Ban the use of face coverings at protests and counter protests.
attributes.background: It has became common practice for protesters to attend protests with their faces totally covered. With the sole aim of causing trouble and escaping police prosecutions. The police rely heavily on video footage to enable prosecutions at later dates and away from a hostile crowd.
attributes.additional_details:
Being able to cover ones face empowers people to commit crimes of assault, criminal damage, racial abuse, etc, that they may not otherwise commit. Much the same as a fake profile online empowers people to say things that they would be to afraid to say on a real profile. 
A law would greatly aid the police in doing their job and keeping the peace at public protests and counter protests. I feel it would reduce the number of offences committed at protests considerably.

attributes.action: Introduce statutory LGBT+ element for Initial Teacher & School Governor Training
attributes.background: A lack of training on the prevention of LGBT+ bullying, means providers like Stonewall & www.inclusionforall.co.uk often work with schools where LGBT+ bullying is already happening. Stonewall research shows almost half of LGBT pupils are bullied at school. Teachers must be trained from the start.
attributes.additional_details: The National LGBT Survey found that a third of respondents who were in education in 2016-2017 said that they experienced a negative reaction during that time due to them being, or people perceiving them to be, LGBT. The most frequent perpetrators of the respondents’ most serious incidents were other students (in 88% of cases) but a tenth (9%) were committed by teaching staff. The resulting action plan focuses heavily on ‘tackling’ not organisational culture change in order to prevent prejudice.

attributes.action: All UK citizens have the right to vote on referendums affecting the UK's future.
attributes.background: The recent BREXIT referendum limited the right of UK citizens to vote on the UK's future on the basis of residence. UK citizens, resident abroad, but still registered in electoral roles, were eligible. However, many others were disenfranchised and unable to vote on issues affecting their future.
attributes.additional_details: UK citizens, working and living in the EU for more than 2 years before the Brexit referendum, were arbitrarily disenfranchised  by the UK Government, and were ineligible to vote on an issue that affected their future and legal standing in the EU. Parliament must ensure that any future referendum affecting the governance of the UK must consult all UK citizens, regardless of residence. Local Consular offices charged with registering all UK citizens abroad, can verify their voting eligibility.

attributes.action: End the 'hostile environment' for immigration & revoke the 2014 immigration act
attributes.background: The 2014 bill the bill makes it as inconvenient and unpleasant as possible to live in Britain without documents by privatising the process of checking status to people in civil society.
attributes.additional_details: This has directly led to the Windrush debacle and quite rightly lots of opprobrium and calls for 'amnesty' for Windrush generation. However the immigration act 2014 is causing issues for all people who have immigrated here and should be revoked.

attributes.action: Bring in and legalise hand signals for riders to ask drivers to slow and stop
attributes.background: Horse riders are confronted with drivers driving too close and too fast causing many accidents to horses and riders, even death, with no convictions. Drivers need to be accountable for their actions, we need to be able to legally ask drivers to slow and stop to keep us safe.
attributes.additional_details: Horses are being left dead on the roads because drivers do not allow down or pass wide, resulting in injured or dead horses with rider injury, no driver can be prosecuted for hitting a horse the only way is for the rider to be admitted to hospital, this is wrong. We see over the hedges, we know if our horse might spook so sometimes we need drivers to stop and give us a few seconds. At the moment legally drivers do not have to abide our signals, we are on a living, sometimes unpredictable, animal.

attributes.action: House of Lords party appointments would be tied to General Election results.
attributes.background: Agree to the Burns report on Lords reform 31/10/2017, House of Lords party appointments would be tied to General Election results. At least 20% would be independents and no party would have a majority. Reduce numbers to 600.
attributes.additional_details: www.parliament.uk/size-of-house-committee

attributes.action: We want Britain to give more help and treatment for people with a Pineal Cyst
attributes.background: Sadly Great Britain does not acknowledge symptomatic Pineal Cysts as other countries do. This leaves sufferers with awful symptoms and no offer of the much needed surgery to help them. This needs to change to allow sufferers to live their lives free from pain.
attributes.additional_details:
Some common symptoms of a pineal cyst can be
* Constant headaches
* vomiting and nausea
* weakness and loss of feeling in one side
* abnormal eye movement and blurriness in vision
* changes in memory and personality
* changes in speech
* drowsiness and seizures
* increased anxiety
* constant fatigue
Other countries offer surgery to remove the cyst but we want more help and support in this country so people don't have to go abroad for help at the cost of tens of thousands of pounds.

attributes.action: Change the colour of becons to red when stationery for recovery vehicles
attributes.background: Unfortunately the use of amber becons do not work any more everything these days seems to have amber lights the recovery industry have lost a lot of people lately doing our job at road side
attributes.additional_details: The construction industry have got green becons when working it makes them stands out we would stand out with red becons and it could save our lives

attributes.action: Give all UK residents the right to vote in local government elections
attributes.background: There should be a change in electoral law to ensure that everyone who is permanently resident in the UK and of voting age has the right to vote in local government elections.
attributes.additional_details: For those who live in a local community, numerous aspects of their daily life – such as housing, education, local amenities, public transport, cultural and sports facilities – are influenced by decisions taken by the local authority. It is therefore only fair to extend the right to vote and be elected in local elections to all long-term UK residents, regardless of their citizenship. Such a move would also ensure that EU citizens retain their right to vote in local elections after Brexit.

attributes.action: Impose sanctions on USA for removing children from immigrant parents at borders
attributes.background: America is currently removing children from their immigrant parents at borders, and placing them alone in detention centres. Its also come to light that they have since 'lost' track of over 1500 children.. the these children have simply disappeared.
